resolution.description: The described issue is not actually a problem - it is as designed.
resolution.name: Not A Problem

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:

require 'arrow'
n = 1000000
arr = n.times.to_a.map\{|i| "test"}

strings = Arrow::StringArray.new(arr)
arrow_table = Arrow::Table.new("str" => strings)
arrow_table.save("data.arrow")
Arrow::Table.load("data.arrow")

comments.body:
How did you install Apache Arrow GLib? {{pacman -S --no-confirm mingw-w64-x86_64-arrow}}?

The following code will work but I don't want users to do this. Users just should use {{require "arrow"}}.

{code:ruby}
require "ruby_installer/runtime"
RubyInstaller::Runtime.add_dll_directory("c:/msys64/mingw64/bin")
require 'arrow'
{code}

{noformat}
pacman -S mingw64/mingw-w64-x86_64-arrow
{noformat}

does it matter that I have my msys2 installed in the e:\ drive?  

{noformat}
E:\msys64\mingw64\bin> 
{noformat}

I have the above in the PATH env variable

Also running fd on the following

{noformat}
E:\msys64\mingw64>fd arrow 
{noformat}

shows the output at https://gist.github.com/dsisnero/88e72a29f8f886a258e7a7c8f28a9fa5

Using your code above in the file , I still have the same problem

{noformat}
C:\Users\Dominic E Sisneros\Documents\programming\ruby\try_arrow>more arrow_load.rb
require 'arrow'

require "ruby_installer/runtime"
RubyInstaller::Runtime.add_dll_directory("e:/msys64/mingw64/bin")
require 'arrow'
n = 1000000
arr = n.times.to_a.map{|i| "test"}

strings = Arrow::StringArray.new(arr)
arrow_table = Arrow::Table.new("str" => strings)
arrow_table.save("data.arrow")
Arrow::Table.load("data.arrow")

C:\Users\Dominic E Sisneros\Documents\programming\ruby\try_arrow>ruby arrow_load.rb
(NULL)-WARNING **: Failed to load shared library 'libarrow-glib-11.dll' referenced by the typelib: 'libarrow-glib-11.dll': The specified procedure could not be found.

e:/rubies/Ruby26-x64/lib/ruby/gems/2.6.0/gems/red-arrow-0.12.0/lib/arrow/loader.rb:85:in `load_object_info': uninitialized constant Arrow::ArrayBuilder (NameError)
{noformat}

You shouldn't do {{require 'arrow'}} before {{add_dll_directory}}.
Could you remove {{require 'arrow'}} at the first line and try again?

And could you try {{ruby -rdevkit arrow_load.rb}}?

I am not sure if it was the latest pacman -Syu or the gem but it is working now without the workaround. 

Thank you so much for all your work.  

I am going through some examples I have seen and some of the tests.  One thing that doesn't work on windows yet is the red-parquet.  Should I open a new issue and close this one out?

{noformat}
[1] pry(main)> require 'arrow'
=> true
[2] pry(main)> require 'parquet'
GObjectIntrospection::RepositoryError::TypelibNotFound: Typelib file for namespace 'Parquet' (any version) not found
from E:/rubies/Ruby26-x64/lib/ruby/gems/2.6.0/gems/gobject-introspection-3.3.6/lib/gobject-introspection/loader.rb:37:in `require'
Caused by LoadError: cannot load such file -- parquet
from E:/rubies/Ruby26-x64/lib/ruby/site_ruby/2.6.0/rubygems/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:54:in `require'
[3] pry(main)>
{noformat}

Also, on windows saving a file to gzipped csv seems to hang

{noformat}
table = Arrow::Table.load('worldcitiespop.csv')
table.save('worldcitiespop.csv.gz', format: :csv, compression: :gzip)
{noformat}

hangs on my computer

Thanks

OK. We can close this because Red Arrow works on Windows.

For red-parquet, we need to enable Parquet in MSYS2 package: https://github.com/msys2/MINGW-packages/blob/master/mingw-w64-arrow/PKGBUILD

For hangs, could you open a new issue?

Ok, created a new issue for Parquet in MSYS2

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5055

Thanks
Transitioning issue from Resolved to Closed to based on resolution field value.
